intro: Jaborosa sativa, commonly known as the common jaborosa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open areas and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Jaborosa sativa is also known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
